basic/scatters.name: markers.py
basic/scatters.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/scatters/markers.py example shows all the different scatter marker types available in Bokeh on a single plot.

basic/scatters.name: color_scatter.py
basic/scatters.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/scatters/color_scatter.py example shows a multicolored scatter plot of random data with hover tool.

basic/scatters.name: elements.py
basic/scatters.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/scatters/elements.py example shows a scatter plot of density vs atomic weight of atomic elements, colormapped by their melting points.

basic/lines.name: lorenz.py
basic/lines.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/lines/lorenz.py example shows a plot of the Lorenz attractor using the MultiLine glyph.

basic/data.name: transform_markers.py
basic/data.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/transform_markers.py example shows a scatter plot of the Palmer penuguins dataset, color- and marker-mapped by species. The x-axis is flipper length (mm) and the y-axis is body mass (g).

basic/data.name: transform_jitter.py
basic/data.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/data/transform_jitter.py example shows a column of two categorical scatter plots of random data. The top has no jitter applied, may scatter points overlap. The bottom has jitter applied to distinguish points better.

basic/axes.name: logplot.py
basic/axes.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/axes/logplot.py example shows a plot of six basic mathematical functions such as y=x and y=x**2 on a log-scale using different lines styles for each.

basic/bars.name: basic.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/basic.py example shows a simple bar chart for counts for categories of fruits.

basic/bars.name: colormapped.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/colormapped.py example shows a simple bar plot with bars for six categories of fruit on the x-axis, and bars shaded with the Bright6 palette.

basic/bars.name: intervals.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/intervals.py example shows an interval chart showing Olympic sprint time data as intervals using blue horizontal bars for times, with a bar for earch year on the y-axis.

basic/bars.name: mixed.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/mixed.py example shows a bar chart of synthetic monthly sales data, grouped by quarter. A line showing each quarterly average is overlaid.

basic/bars.name: nested_colormapped.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/nested_colormapped.py example shows a grouped bar chart on a hierachical categorical axis of years for different categories of fruit. Each group has a silver, blue, and red bar corresponding to random values for years 2015, 2016 and 2017.

basic/bars.name: pandas_groupby_colormapped.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/pandas_groupby_colormapped.py example shows a bar chart of MPG vs cylinders using the Auto MPG dataset, colormapped by the number of cylinders.

basic/bars.name: pandas_groupby_nested.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/pandas_groupby_nested.py example shows a grouped bar chart of MPG vs cylinders and manufacturer, using the Auto MPG dataset. The bars are grouped and colormapped by the number of cylinders.

basic/bars.name: stacked.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/stacked.py example shows a stacked bar chart for random data for six categories of fruit. Each row in the stack corresponds to a different year.

basic/bars.name: stacked_split.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/stacked_split.py example.

basic/bars.name: nested.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/nested.py example shows a grouped bar chart on a hierachical categorical axis of years for different categories of fruit. Each group has three blue bars corresponding to random values for years 2015, 2016 and 2017.

basic/bars.name: colors.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/colors.py example shows a simple bar chart of six bars shaded according to the Bright6 palette.

basic/bars.name: dodged.py
basic/bars.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/bars/dodged.py example shows a grouped bar chart using a visual dodge on the bars, rather than a hierarchical axis. Each group has a silver, blue, and red bar illustrated in the accompanying legend.

basic/areas.name: stacked_area.py
basic/areas.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/areas/stacked_area.py example shows a stacked area plot of synthetic data for ten series, colormapped using the Sunset palette, with a legend at the top.

basic/layouts.name: anscombe.py
basic/layouts.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/layouts/anscombe.py example shows a gridplot of four scatter and regression line plots illustrating Anscombe's Quartet.

basic/annotations.name: legend.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/legend.py example shows a row of two plots that have sine waves in different scatter and line styles, illustrated in accompanying legends.

basic/annotations.name: box_annotation.py
basic/annotations.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/annotations/box_annotation.py example shows a timeseries plot of glucose data readings with red box annotations marking regions where the readings are too high or too low.

basic/styling.name: hatch_grid_band.py
basic/styling.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/basic/styling/hatch_grid_band.py example shows a sine wave with hatched grid bands underneath.

topics/images.name: image_rgba.py
topics/images.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/images/image_rgba.py example shows an image plot of synthetic RGBA data.

topics/images.name: image.py
topics/images.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/images/image.py example shows a plot with a colormapped two-dimensonal sine surface.

topics/mathtext.name: latex_blackbody_radiation.py
topics/mathtext.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/mathtext/latex_blackbody_radiation.py example shows plot of spectral radiance curves for an ideal radiating blackbody at various temperatures with mathtext axis labels.

topics/mathtext.name: latex_normal_distribution.py
topics/mathtext.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/mathtext/latex_normal_distribution.py example shows a plot of the sampled and ideal Gaussian distribution with mathtext axis tick labels.

topics/mathtext.name: latex_schrodinger.py
topics/mathtext.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/mathtext/latex_schrodinger.py example shows solutions of Schrödinger’s equation for the motion of a particle in one dimension in a parabolic potential well for eight energy levels, with mathtext labels for each solution.

topics/mathtext.name: latex_bessel.py
topics/mathtext.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/mathtext/latex_bessel.py example shows a plot with the first four Bessel function J_0 to J_3 with mathtext labels and a mathtext title.

topics/contour.name: contour_simple.py
topics/contour.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/contour/contour_simple.py example shows an iso-contour plot with ten levels between -2 and 2.

topics/hex.name: hex_tile.py
topics/hex.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/hex/hex_tile.py example shows a hex tile plot of binned 2d random (Gaussian) data points, colormapped by density with the Viridis palette.

topics/hex.name: hexbin.py
topics/hex.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/hex/hexbin.py example shows a hexbin plot of 2d random (Gaussian) data points, colormapped by density with the Viridis palette.

topics/categorical.name: ridgeplot.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/ridgeplot.py example shows a ridgeline plot using the Perceptions of Probability dataset with a smoothed distribution displayed for each probability category on the y-axis.

topics/categorical.name: scatter_jitter.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/scatter_jitter.py example shows a categorical scatter plot of several years of GitHub commits. The y-axis is day of the week and the x-axis is time of day, with scater points jittered to avoid overlap

topics/categorical.name: les_mis.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/les_mis.py example shows a reproduction of D3’s Les Misérables Co-occurrence chart that illustrates which characters were in scenes together with a shaded square in the matrix plot.

topics/categorical.name: heatmap_unemployment.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/categorical/heatmap_unemployment.py example shows a categorical heatmap of monthly US unemployment data from 1948 to 2016. The x-axis is years and the y-axis is month of the year.

topics/categorical.name: periodic.py
topics/categorical.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/periodic.py example shows a plot that renders the periodic table of elements.

topics/geo.name: texas_hover_map.py
topics/geo.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/geo/texas_hover_map.py example shows a color-mapped map plot based on Texas unemployment rate per county, colormapped using the Viridis palette.

topics/geo.name: eclipse.py
topics/geo.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/geo/eclipse.py example shows a plot of US states overlaid with a trajectory marking the path of the August 2017 solar eclipse.

topics/graph.name: node_and_edge_attributes.py
topics/graph.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/graph/node_and_edge_attributes.py example shows a network graph plot of the NetworkX karate club dataset with large circles for vertices.

topics/pie.name: pie.py
topics/pie.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/pie/pie.py example shows a pie chart of random data with a legend.

topics/pie.name: donut.py
topics/pie.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/pie/donut.py example shows a donut chart of browser share percentages with a legend.

topics/pie.name: burtin.py
topics/pie.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/pie/burtin.py example shows a reproduction of Burtin's hitorical antibiotics plot.

topics/stats.name: histogram.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/histogram.py example shows a histogram of sampled data from a normal (Gaussian) distribution overlaid with a line showing the ideal distribution curve.

topics/stats.name: splom.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/splom.py example shows a SPLOM gridplot of the penguins data set.

topics/stats.name: boxplot.py
topics/stats.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/topics/stats/boxplot.py example shows a box plot of synthetic data for six categories.

interaction/tools.name: range_tool.py
interaction/tools.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/interaction/tools/range_tool.py example shows a column of two plots of timeseries plots of stock price data. The bottom plot shows all the data and has a range tool for controlling the viewport of the top plot.

interaction/js_callbacks.name: slider.py
interaction/js_callbacks.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/slider.py example shows a layout with a sine plot on the left and sliders on the right to control the sine wave properties such as frequency and phase.

interaction/js_callbacks.name: color_sliders.py
interaction/js_callbacks.alt: Thumbnail link to the examples/plotting/color_sliders.py example shows a layout with RGB sliders on the left to control a plot on the right. A colorbar with hover tool is underneath.
